sentences: Alexander Israilevich Rudin (born 1960) is a Russian classical cellist and conductor.
Rudin was born in 1960, in Moscow, and he studied piano and cello at the Gnessin Institute before later studying conducting at the Moscow Conservatory with Dmitri Kitayenko.
As conductor, Rudin works with student orchestras, and has been the director of the Musica Viva Chamber Orchestra since 1988.
He also teaches at Ya≈üar University, Izmir, Turkey where he is entitled as the music director.
